name: Mantel Clock (Pendule)
maker: Case attributed to Robert Osmond, and movement by Étienne Le Noir II, in partnership with his son Pierre Étienne Le Noir
description: Mantel Clock (Pendule); Case attributed to Robert Osmond (French, about 1720 - 1789, master 1746), and movement by Étienne Le Noir II (French, 1699 - 1778, master 1717), in partnership with his son Pierre Étienne Le Noir (French, born about 1725, master 1743); Paris, France; about 1763; Patinated and gilt bronze; enameled metal; glass; 54.3 x 45.1 x 23.2 cm (21 3/8 x 17 3/4 x 9 1/8 in.); 73.DB.85; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
title: Mantel Clock (Pendule)
medium: Patinated and gilt bronze; enameled metal; glass
